data.author: Ben Chapman-Kish

changelog.release_notes: This is not a content update, but rather an update adding colourful graphics and compatibility with the new Pebble Time!

Cold War Simulator 2K15, version 1.3 is here! This is the last update for content that was part of my original vision for this app. Two new options, based on less interaction between nations, but on your own nation. "Produce Nukes": Increase your power, but at what risk? "Push Research": Assemble a research team to develop new technologies, just make sure that none of your researchers are spies. The instructions screen is also improved, so that it's aesthetically better and it also shows automatically the first time the app is run. It can also now be closed with the select button. Enjoy what is probably the final content release!
Added turn counter, turn history, and options

Huzzah! You can now press down to repeat the last action committed, and there are now a few more possible outcomes for existing options as well. Some back-end stuff was done as well, to improve functionality and prepare for future updates. Up next: View the history of your actions committed and their outcomes.

data.description:
It's a number of years after the most recent global war and tensions are heating up between you and the other world superpower. The fate of the world is in your hands as you use strategy and wits to either defeat them by force or by persuading them to demilitarize. Fight proxy wars, send spies, make pleas to cut down on the nukes, and more in this thrilling new game. Now with colours for Pebble Time.

Disclaimer: This is a tongue-in-cheek satirical parody of both the cold war and of modern â€œsimulator" games. The bad art style and trivial gameplay is intentional. Hope you enjoy it!
